In this work we answer this question affirmatively by presenting an algorithm that, for any undirected graph  G  and Iµ>0, outputs a (1+Iµ)-spectral sparsifier of  G  with  O ( n /Iµ 2 ) edges in � ( m /Iµ  O (1) ) time. Our algorithm is based on three novel techniques: (1) a new potential function which is much easier to compute yet has similar guarantees as the potential functions used in previous references; (2) an efficient reduction from a two-sided spectral sparsifier to a one-sided spectral sparsifier; (3) constructing a one-sided spectral sparsifier by a semi-definite program.
